column4: any idea of why an ASUS Eee 1201n keyboard doesn't respond on 9.10 booted from an USB source?
can you rephrase the question it was a bit confusing?
I booted Ubuntu 9.10 on my new ASUS Eee 1201n using a pendrive (which holds the OS image) and the keyboard doesn't work
haven't done much testing yet but I'm pretty desoriented anyway
hmm... it may have to do with the usb controller..
I've doubted about the live cd being booted from USB too
have to tried to enable ps/2 emulation in the bios?
how would that help?
oh
it would make your mouse and keyboard act like they are not usb devices
wait, no..
the USB device is the pendrive, from which I'm booting karmic
does it actually boot karmic
the keyboard not working is the one of my netbook asus 1201n
yes it does
the only thing not working is the netbook's keyboard
does it let you use the keyboard during the boot loader?
didn't try that.. but wait.. right now stupid W7 is applying some updates, I'll ping you when I'm rebooting
I'll see if keyboard respond before launching X when I'm there
I tried the famous acpi=off nolapic and the keyboard is working, lulz
lulz indead
works for live, once installed I can be sure of what it is (if it still doesn't work without the arguments)
